newsitem.title: JAPAN: Shimizu Bank sees lower 1996/97 parent profits.
newsitem.headline: Shimizu Bank sees lower 1996/97 parent profits.

text.p: Shimizu Bank Ltd said on Friday that its parent current profit and net profit for the year to March 31, 1997, would be about 20 percent smaller than the bank's November forecast.
It did not provide specific figures for the new forecast.
The bank said its appraisal loss on securities holdings at the end of March 1997 was 1.54 billion yen.

In November, Shimizu Bank said that it would post a parent current profit of 7.2 billion yen and a net profit of four billion yen. Its 1995/96 actual parent current profit was 6.45 billion yen, while its net profit was 2.62 billion yen.
